name: Litti Chokha
description: The iconic rustic dish of Bihar, featuring baked wheat balls stuffed with spiced gram flour.
longDescription: Litti Chokha is the soul food of Bihar. The litti are baked dough balls stuffed with roasted chickpea flour (sattu), herbs, and spices, traditionally roasted over coal fire and dipped in ghee. It is served with chokha, a mash of roasted vegetables.

name: Thekua
description: A crispy and sweet deep-fried biscuit traditionally prepared during Chhath Puja.
longDescription: Thekua is a revered sweet snack from Bihar made from whole wheat flour, jaggery or sugar, and ghee. It is pressed into wooden molds before being deep-fried, giving it a distinctive pattern and rich flavor.

name: Kadhi Badi
description: Soft gram flour dumplings simmered in a tangy yogurt-based curry.
longDescription: Kadhi Badi is a comforting household staple in Bihar, consisting of gram flour fritters cooked in a spiced yogurt gravy and enjoyed with steamed rice.

name: Sattu Paratha
description: A nutritious flatbread stuffed with spiced roasted gram flour.
longDescription: Sattu Paratha is a protein-rich breakfast dish where whole wheat parathas are filled with a spicy mixture of sattu, onions, green chilies, and mustard oil.

name: Dal Pitha
description: Steamed rice flour dumplings filled with spiced lentils.
longDescription: Dal Pitha is a healthy traditional delicacy made by steaming rice flour dumplings stuffed with a seasoned lentil filling, similar to savory momos.

name: Khaja
description: A layered crispy dessert soaked in sugar syrup.
longDescription: Khaja is a famous sweet from Silao, made by deep-frying layered dough and soaking it in sugar syrup, resulting in a crispy yet juicy texture.

name: Malpua
description: A sweet pancake fried in ghee and dipped in syrup.
longDescription: Malpua is a festive dessert made from flour, milk, and bananas, fried in ghee and soaked in sugar syrup, especially popular during Holi.

name: Chana Ghugni
description: A spicy evening snack made from black chickpeas.
longDescription: Ghugni is a popular street food prepared with boiled black chickpeas cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices, often eaten with puffed rice.

name: Sattu Sharbat
description: A cooling summer drink made from roasted gram flour.
longDescription: Sattu Sharbat is a nutritious drink made by mixing sattu with water, lemon juice, black salt, and roasted cumin powder, known for instant energy.

name: Bihari Mutton Curry
description: A robust slow-cooked mutton curry with deep flavors.
longDescription: Bihari Mutton Curry is cooked using mustard oil, onions, and whole spices in a single-pot style, producing rich and smoky flavors.
